intro: Biscutella tarnensis, commonly known as the Tarn biscuitflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. Biscutella tarnensis is known for its delicate appearance and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its ecological and ornamental value.
